intro: Cinchona coccinea, commonly known as the scarlet cinchona, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Cinchona coccinea is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine.
